content:
Diagnosis
	1. Oral cavity adenoid cystic carcinoma, T4aN2bM0 at diagnosis
	2. Progressive disease with new pulmonary metastases

	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Composite resection with free flap reconstruction

	Radiotherapy
	1 Mar - 15 Apr 2024 Adjuvant IMRT 66Gy in 33 fractions to primary site and bilateral neck

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease with new pulmonary metastases

	Current issues
	Breathlessness on exertion
Persistent oral pain
Dysphagia requiring soft diet

	Summary of consultation
	This 56-year-old gentleman has unfortunately developed progressive disease. Recent CT chest performed on 15 May 2024 shows multiple new bilateral pulmonary nodules, largest measuring 2.1cm in right lower lobe. NGS testing has identified an NTRK fusion, making him eligible for targeted therapy.

He reports increasing breathlessness on exertion over the past month, though maintains PS 1. Oral pain persists requiring regular opioid analgesia. Weight has dropped by 3kg since last review.

On examination, oral cavity shows expected post-surgical changes with no obvious local recurrence. Chest examination reveals scattered crackles bilaterally.

	Further investigations
	MRI head with contrast - to exclude intracranial metastases
PET-CT - for full staging update

	Medication prescribed
	Larotrectinib 100mg BD to start pending funding approval

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 2 weeks with scan results
Urgent referral to palliative care team made

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor renal function and LFTs weekly during first month of targeted therapy

	Summary of information given to patient
	Discussed progressive disease and treatment options including clinical trials. Patient understands palliative intent of further treatment.
